text:
Hi <@U05QEMEKHMF>, I just got out from a long support case with HubSpot. Apparently it used to be possible to create workflows directly at the developer portal but when they introduced the test accounts this is no longer possible. The conclusion is: It is no longer possible to test unpublished custom actions anymore. (But they are looking into it?).

Hope this helps you and some other poor soul searching for answers.

When a Portal that is using a <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/automation/custom-workflow-actions|custom workflow action> from a Marketplace app uninstalls the given app, is it expected behavior to HubSpot still run the workflow action even though the app has been uninstalled?

I see that HubSpot shows that the account needs to be reconnected to use this given action, but per our tests (and from what we have seen in production), HubSpot still executes the action, which feels a bit weird knowing that the app has been uninstalled.
Hi, can someone help me fixing this "not defined in code" error. The output is defined and I keep receiving this error.

I am basically trying to get a 12h format value and convert it to 24h format. Then I want to store this value into another property. I don't know what it's wrong, the code executes and the logs are okay.

the output object needs to have a base level “outputFields” key within the object. Try structuring like so:
```callback({outputFields: {militaryTime: value}})```
